reviews.review_text:
My partner and I were staying at the Hyatt here and we took the “cook with the chefs” class. We highly recommend it!! You get to pick one chaat, one main, and one dessert, and they prep the ingredients for you and then walk you through making the recipe. We did the chulha signature palak patte ki chaat, Goan style chicken chili fry and pistachio gulab jamun. The food was fresh and DELICIOUS and the chefs were very attentive and kind, we asked a bunch of questions and they answered everything. The price was also very reasonable.
We dined there for our last night and ordered a lot of small dishes, which were all fantastic. The chicken and fish are packed with flavor, very good even for an Indian palette. The cocktails are a little more hit or miss, but there are definitely some gems on their menu, which they rotate out regularly. The orange margarita was our favorite, great spices and tanginess from the tamarind sauce.
You HAVE to try their palak patte ki chaat!
They threw in a jalebi for dessert, which comes with a creamy custard and the combo is to die for. I don’t really think you can go wrong!

Contrary to Chulha's high ranking and name it is a dissapointing experience overall.
The ambience and decor is good.Seating is not too comfortable.Food options are good but unfortunately post taking our orders ,the staff come back and say many of the dishes are not available,especially their signature cocktails.They are not sure of the availability of many other dishes too and ask time to check and confirm.This is totally  unexpected and ridiculous, especially in a restaurant of Hyatt's repute.Except for some, most of the staff including the entrance desk,seem uninterested to welcome or serve the guests.Ordered dishes were good though,although extremely pricey ,including their high service charges,for the overall mid experience !! Definitely not recommended!!
